edu.luc.cs.trull
Class AbstractComponent

java.lang.Object
  edu.luc.cs.trull.EmptyComponent
      edu.luc.cs.trull.TerminatingComponent
          edu.luc.cs.trull.AbstractComponent
All Implemented Interfaces:
Component, java.util.EventListener, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, PropertyChangeSource, SchedulerAware, Startable, Suspendable, Terminating
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractCombinator, EmitComponent
public abstract class AbstractComponent
extends TerminatingComponent

An abstract superclass for components. In particular, this class provides support for adding and removing listeners and firing events to the listeners.

Method Detail

addPropertyChangeListener

public void addPropertyChangeListener(java.beans.PropertyChangeListener l)
Description copied from interface: PropertyChangeSource
Adds a PropertyChangeListener to this component. Implementing classes that do not emit any PropertyChangeEvents may choose to implement this an empty method.

Specified by:
addPropertyChangeListener in interface PropertyChangeSource
Overrides:
addPropertyChangeListener in class EmptyComponent

firePropertyChange

protected void firePropertyChange(java.beans.PropertyChangeEvent event)
Fires the given PropertyChangeEvent.

Parameters:
event - the event to be fired.

firePropertyChange

protected void firePropertyChange(java.lang.String label)
Fires a PropertyChangeEvent whose property name is the given label.

Parameters:
label - the property name of the event to be fired.

firePropertyChange

protected void firePropertyChange(java.lang.String label,
                                  java.lang.Object value)
Fires a PropertyChangeEvent whose property name is the given label and whose new value is the given object.

Parameters:
label - the property name of the event to be fired.
value - the new property value of the event to be fired.

getExternalListeners

protected PropertyChangeMulticaster getExternalListeners()
Returns the external listeners as a single multicaster.

Returns:
the multicaster object.

getPropertyChangeListeners

public java.beans.PropertyChangeListener[] getPropertyChangeListeners()
Description copied from interface: PropertyChangeSource
Returns the array of PropertyChangeListeners listening to this component. Implementing classes that do not emit any PropertyChangeEvents should return an empty array.

Specified by:
getPropertyChangeListeners in interface PropertyChangeSource
Overrides:
getPropertyChangeListeners in class EmptyComponent

removePropertyChangeListener

public void removePropertyChangeListener(java.beans.PropertyChangeListener l)
Description copied from interface: PropertyChangeSource
Removes a PropertyChangeListener from this component. Implementing classes that do not emit any PropertyChangeEvents may choose to implement this an empty method.

Specified by:
removePropertyChangeListener in interface PropertyChangeSource
Overrides:
removePropertyChangeListener in class EmptyComponent
